answer:
Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis:

• Frame 1: The roadway is clear of foot traffic. Large trucks are parked on the left and right side; no pedestrians are in the crosswalk.  
• Frame 2: Still no pedestrians visible in the crosswalk. Same trucks on either side.  
• Frame 3: Two people have begun stepping into the crosswalk area—one wearing a safety vest, the other in a white shirt.  
• Frame 4: A third person (in a light‐colored shirt) joins them in the crosswalk, so now three individuals are visibly crossing.  
• Frame 5: All three continue walking together across the crosswalk in front of the camera’s vehicle.  

Contextual Reasoning:  
The key change occurs between Frames 2 and 3, where pedestrians suddenly appear. By Frame 4, it is clear that three distinct individuals are crossing, and all remain visible in Frame 5.  

Matching to Answer Choices:  
Only one choice aligns with seeing exactly three people crossing the road in front of the camera, which is “C. 3.”  

<answer>C</answer>
